mdRecord.dcterms:title: Bradford Porch, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: On the r. a winding passage [from the Bath House] with rustic decoration of fir cones ... leads to the Bradford Porch, from which one emerges into a walled garden. The porch is a genuine late 15c fragment from the manor house at Bradford-on-Avon, which was demolished in 1938. The porch was moved here in 1967 (Ernest Tew, architect). -- Pevsner and Cherry, Wiltshire, 1976. [work]
